original_solution_mapping.L1: From all the computers, 100% - 40% - 20% = 40% got fixed right away.
original_solution_mapping.L2: So John was able to fix 40/100 * 20 = <<40/100*20=8>>8 computers.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6680.
    Returns: the number of computers John was able to fix right away.
    """
    # L1
    total_percentage = 100 # WK
    waiting_percentage = 40 # 40% of them needed to wait
    unfixable_percentage = 20 # 20% of them were unfixable
    fixed_right_away_percentage = total_percentage - waiting_percentage - unfixable_percentage

    # L2
    fixed_right_away_fraction = Fraction(fixed_right_away_percentage, 100)
    total_computers = 20 # fix 20 computers
    computers_fixed_right_away = fixed_right_away_fraction * total_computers

    # FA
    answer = computers_fixed_right_away
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: From all the computers, {total_percentage}% - {waiting_percentage}% - {unfixable_percentage}% = {fixed_right_away_percentage}% got fixed right away.
So John was able to fix {fixed_right_away_fraction} * {total_computers} = <<{fixed_right_away_fraction}*{total_computers}={computers_fixed_right_away}>>{computers_fixed_right_away} computers.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: From all the computers, 100% - 40% - 20% = 40% got fixed right away.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: So John was able to fix 40/100 * 100 = <<40/100*100=40>>40 computers.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_percentage' (100) was used instead of 'total_computers' (20).
